Reviews.Title: “You might ask, why no pictures of the RV park? Because its terrible. There's a few reasons its ranked one of the worst places to”
Reviews.Author: TarvelingTara
Reviews.Content: Ok I have several reasons why this 'resort' is terrible. 1. The pool, dirty and the fencing has jagged rusty nails poking out everywhere. 2. The ridiculous playground is an infection waiting to happen. Sharp metal is sticking out of the 1 swing and monkey bars.there is an infant swing but its that rough yellow cordage that cuts skin. Who in their right mind would look at this playground and think 'yep, its good enough!' Not to mention the boat kids are automatically drawn to...I almost lost my mind at that point. I was so done with this place I picked my 2 year old up and we left. 3. The showers. You have to see them to believe me. Nasty stagnant water and mold everywhere. As one reviewer said, they should be condemned. 4. There is nothing, and I emphasize nothing, for children to do at this 'resort'. There is a half hung volleyball net, a deflated ball and a few rackets near it. 5. You are staying in the middle of a really shabby trailer park. Every person we talked to did the same thing we did, drove right past it thinking 'this can NOT be it...' Yes my friends, you have been duped as well. 6. Maximize profit seems to be their main goal, which hey...the American dream, go for it. But cleaning your facilities doesn't cost a lot. Painting and showing pride of ownership makes people want to come back. 7. The lots are jam packed and you have a tiny crumbling concrete pad to place your items on. No grass anywhere and you stare at your neighbors. Not a big deal as I'm a friendly person and like getting to know people however, this was a joke. I do want everyone to know I'm not afraid of germs or getting dirty, this place is beyond terrible. I camp almost weekly and this is the worst place I've ever stayed in. We left after less than 12 hours. I will say they gave us a refund but not before the 'we just don't understand what's wrong?' question. I have never written a negative review but this place just crossed the line. Tara

Reviews.Title: “Great cabin/lake getaway!”
Reviews.Author: Allimison1788
Reviews.Content: After reading a few horrible reviews of this resort, I was very scared to stay, but with great surprise we love it! We rented a log cabin which is as waterfront as it gets on table rock lake (because the core of engineers owns a certain amount of land). We were In a quite cove, with a large dock for all of the renters. We were lucky enough to find a half price sale, too. The cabin is very clean and plenty large for us 3. We are used to older cabins on lakes and were impressed overall. We originally asked the desk on thurs if we needed to reserve a fishing boat for that sat just in case, they said they had plenty, so we didn't, Saturday we tried to get the boat and they were all gone. The next option was three times the price of the one we wanted. We mentioned it and they gave us the bigger boat for the lower price, no questions asked! All very friendly knowledgable staff. Minutes from silver dollar city, few more minutes to the strip but easy to find. Everything worked fine. The cabins are furnished with unmatched items but you have to understand-these resorts have numerous cabins and condos to maintain and furnish so they have to obtain everything as cheap as possible, especially in Branson, which is a little slow on tourism right now. Everything was great and we will probably be back.

Reviews.Title: “RV Park, rental trailers and bath house should be condemed”
Reviews.Author: Marie S
Reviews.Content: After booking a camp site at Trails End and reading the reviews we were shocked at the condition of the park. The sites were to have full hookups with cable. The cable doesn't work, the restroom/shower house should be condemed as it even had vice grips for a handle on the shower, and were so nasty it was discusting. The pull through sites were inpossible to get into in our fifthwheel so we could not use the sewer hook up. The concrete pads are broken and such a tripping hazard it's a wonder some one hasn't sued them over falling and getting hurt. The picnic tables and grills were impossible to use as their conditions were a disaster. It looks like the Indian Point property association would make them clear the property and start over from fresh. We were so dissapointed in out stay and we won't be back. Don't believe everything you read or see on these properties until you check it out yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Great Dock, Nasty Rooms”
Reviews.Author: paintridinchik
Reviews.Content: We had seen Trail's End on the outside in March. We chose it because of the nice dock and proximity to the lake. I reserved a two bedroom "resort unit" with a kitchenette, the lowest priced option. I had seen a floor plan online and thought it would be okay. Upon arrival it was NASTY- tiny room, hideous smell, I've stayed at some funky places on various lakes, but this was too gross for even my dedicated group of lake rats. Luckily we were able to get a cabin which was basic, but much better. The only problem was that it had no oven (we cook at the lake). My friends had to upgrade to a condo, which was very nice. The only problem is that both familles blew our budgets way out of the water because of the upgrade in accomodations. Access to the dock and lake were great, dock was one of the best we've ever used. Too bad the "resort" units would only be a resort to various kinds of vermin!

Reviews.Title: “Could have been great, but ruined our vacation!”
Reviews.Author: Mickell
Reviews.Content: The log cabin we booked at Trails End was in a beautiful setting. My husband and I took our son, daughter-in-law and grandchildren for a Christmas Trip and visit to Silver Dollar City. The cabin was okay, but the beds absolutely ruined our trip!! The "hide-a-bed" was dirty and uncomfortable. A door on the lower kitchen cabinets almost fell off in our hands. The TV was almost too small to see. We had been informed prior to our trip that wood was available for the fireplace, but when we called to get wood we were told we would need to "steal" it from a different cabin, which we did not do because the fireplace was virtually unusable anyway because of it's location in the corner of the room.. We asked for toilet tissue and were told we could come to the office and get it. All in all, this beautiful setting on the lake is wasted on poor service and cheap amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: Britt1209
Reviews.Content: Wow. My husband and I booked this place for our anniversary. We arrived to find our " new studio lakeview room" was disgusting. Construction was still going. Great view if you enjoy trees, gravel parking and construction equipment. Carpet was nasty and smelled of urine. "marble" countertops were faux marble and kelly green at that. Mattress felt like it had been stuffed with hay. 12 inch tube TV in "suite" was nothing short of comical. We asked for an upgraded room and were given keys to one that was worse. When I stepped back into the office the 205 year old woman asked " what the hell is wrong with that one?!" We requested a refund and were denied. They told me to take it up with my financial institution. Stay away from this place.

Reviews.Title: “Very beautiful, loved the cabin and the view”
Reviews.Author: murraykc423
Reviews.Content: What a great time. This was my first time to Branson, I was very suprized by the room. The reviews I read online were very misleading... to me anyway. Thought it was beautiful the covered deck with two rocking chairs, picnic table, and some wood. The kitchen had everything you would need to make a great stay at home meal. They had webber grills outside for you to use. Perfect view of Table Rock Lake. The wildlife was breath taking. Bluejays that woud take a peanut right from my hand. I went with my 1 1/2 yr old son.. He loved it as well. He slept great and was able to take a bath at night.. The playground wasnt to hot but I thought ahead.. I brought him toys his playpen to sleep in..I brought my own pillows towels.. No your not really gona have room service but hey your there to camp.. Learn to ruff it folks.. If your plaing on staying here and want the best home cooked meal head just down the road of trails end and eat at, Restraunt if they dont have what you want tell them they will make what ever you want.. Great service great people. If your wanting a nice get away with the comforts of home then stay at the Trails End loved it loved it and would and hopes I get to stay there again :)

Reviews.Title: “Never Again!”
Reviews.Author: Juley10
Reviews.Content: We arrived about two p.m. to check in and the staff hatefully said we were early but had the room checked and we were able to get in at that time. There were No other people staying in our type of rooms so I don't know what the big deal was of us checking in early. The place was not even close to half full. We thought we had rented a cabin but it was more like a really small duplex. The room was clean and the bed was fairly comfortable. Everything was really old and outdated though. Our friends stayed at the rv site which was a very small space with no fire ring and too close to the cabins. It was all concrete and gravel as well. The swimming pool by our room was being repainted and the water in the hot tub looked dirty and nasty. The pool over by the office had water in it but was covered so we didn't even check out the hot tub there. The third pool over by the game room was okay but still needed to be cleaned because their was debris swimming on to of the water. The hot tub did not have water in it at all. This was all very dissappointing since this the heated pools and hot tubs was the main reason we picked to stay here. Saturday night we decided to hang out at the game room for awhile. The jukebox wouldn't take our money, the pinball machine took our money but didn't not work, and a racing video game stole our money as well. There was a ping pong table but you had to buy the ping pong balls out of a machine and it ripped us off too. So, one video game worked which was pacman and the guys were able to play pool but that cost as well. Just very very dissappointed with the ammenieties of this place. Unless you are there to stay in one of the newer facilities and use the lake, I would not reccommend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Know what you're getting.”
Reviews.Author: Missouri_Guy70
Reviews.Content: I understand that some of the newer portions of the resorts are very nice and people who stayed at these were pleased. However, the older units appear not to be maintained well and there is some deception about these units. I noted that there are no pictures of the older units on the website and the diagrams that are provided are disproportional. {Below is what I included in a letter to the management of Indian Point Resorts. I sent the letter on 8/9/2007 and never received a response. I can see by some of the other reviews on this site, that I wasn't the only one with an issue.} It was not a good stay due to three major issues: Mold, roaches and the size of the unit. When we arrived, we found that the unit had a strong odor of mold and that odor was there the entire 5 nights. The air in the room was always humid in spite of the constantly running air conditioner. I noted that there was space around the air conditioning unit that allowed outside air into the unit. This may have been part of the problem. Our clothes retained the moldy odor even after we left. We found roaches in the unit. We had to be careful to store all our food, including dry stuffs, in the refrigerator to protect them. We also used disinfectant constantly on the counter tops. When I made the reservations, I used Indian Point Resorts' website to research the amenities. The website shows a diagram of the unit but neither the diagram nor the narrative, had details on the unit's dimensions. Based on the relative sizes of the cabinets and furniture depicted in the diagram, it appeared that the unit would be spacious enough for our needs. However, when we arrived, we found the unit was much smaller than expected. In reviewing the diagram, I found that even though its perimeter was proportional to the perimeter of the actual unit, the furniture (beds, table, cabinets, etc.) was not. The furniture was depicted much smaller in the diagram which, without any dimensions, gives the impression of a more spacious unit. I felt this was deliberate. However, I would like to compliment the staff. Each time we communicated with them, they were knowledgeable and very helpful. When we reported a problem with a window's blinds, a repairman appeared with new blinds within 10 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Rundown, bugs water problems”
Reviews.Author: vlynnSt_Louis_MO
Reviews.Content: The staff was very accomadating and maintanance was good. HOWEVER, we were in the cabins, bugs all over, one bathroom flooded, no hot water in kitchen, the toilet started leaking, the shower you had either hot water or cold water nothing in between. I go to Branson 4 times a year going back to Stillwaters, thought I would change places for a variety........MISTAKE!

Reviews.Title: “OUTSTANDING ACCOMODATIONS AT INDIAN POINT RESORTS!”
Reviews.Author: AidaTexas
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Indian Point Resorts in Branson, MO. This is a top notch resort! The staff is outstanding--ready and willing to assist with any of your needs! We called in advance and Marilyn booked several shows for us. Also, we were very close to all the activities in Branson (including Silver Dollar City amusement park), and we had a beautufil view of Table Rock Lake. We will definitely stay there again when we go to Branson!

Reviews.Title: “Can't believe it was $100 a night”
Reviews.Author: joschef
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights at this facility, spending $100 a night and it was certainly not up to that kind of quality. There were cockroaches in the kitchen, cobwebs on the lamps, dust on the bathroom fixtures and a very thin door with a flimsy lock. The window air conditioner worked but it was so dusty that we were uncomfortable using it. The people in the office were very nice but it was definitely over priced. The first room they offered us smelt so strong of smoke that there was no way we could stay. The second room they offered, and which we took, was double beds instead of queen like we ordered. They said it was a more valuable room because it was a lake front but that was not important to us. It was uncomfortable to sleep in a double bed with my sister but we managed. There is no way I would recommend this facility.

Reviews.Title: “Run Down on Indian Point !”
Reviews.Author: Wildman80
Reviews.Content: i have stayed at trails end resort for 11 years,they have not upgraded 1 thing,still the same curtins,towels matress, sheets carpet. I asked last year if any upgrades were in the future,the front desk manager told me that last winter they were goin to remodel,but nothing?I guess if folks like me stoped staying ther they might get message!

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs - Beware”
Reviews.Author: funbob40
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Trail's End Resort Cabins during the 4th of July weekend and paid the price. 1. Since we stayed that weekend, rates were at a premium, but even at the half the rate, my expectations we're not met based on the information found on their website. 2. The cabin's are out of date and we had to get our window unit AC unit replaced while we there. 3. My wife and I and my kids all ended up with what obviously appears to be "bed bugs" bite all over. Once we got back home, we had to wash all of clothers before enter our house in fear of having brought some back with us. When I expressed my concerns to the front desk, they offer no solutions or even concerns and only blamed in it on the rain. If I had it to do all over again, I would not stay here at half the price. When you can't even get a restful night sleep because you are worried about bugs biting you while in the bed, it's not worth it at any price. I can not recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Fun place for a few days”
Reviews.Author: tinjen
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the units in the 4-plex unit. It was very close to the pool and hot tub Our unit was not "fancy" but was enough to meet our needs. If you plan to sit inside all day, you will want to find a different place to stay. However, just for eating a few meals and sleeping it was fine. The unit had 2 beds in it. Bring more pillows with you if you plan to stay as they only had 2 per bed. The TV was old but there were several channels to pick from other than just local channels and the picture was actually good for being such an old TV. It was on top of the refrigerator which made it difficult to get to and a short person would have to stand on a chair to get to the TV. It also made it difficult to watch because of the way everything had to be arranged in the room. The window unit A/C had to be on "high" or "off" so sometimes it was too cold which was better than being too hot since we were there in July. The chairs in the unit were very hard and uncomfortable. The bathroom was a full size bath with full size bath and shower. The pool area was only about 25steps away from our unit. The pool was nice sized and went up to 9 feet deep. There was also a hot tub. The pool area was clean and there were plenty of chairs and tables. There was a small playground area next to the pool. Our unit had a balcony with a picnic table on it with a great view of the lake in the backyard area. There was a charcoal grill below the balcony so cooking outdoors and eating was very easy and there was a great view. I would recommend you make sure you know what type of unit you are renting. The people next to us thought they were getting a log cabin and were surprised to find they did not. They felt like the information on the resort's website was difficult to figure out exactly what type of facility they would be in. I did have to agree the information on the website is a little confusing as to what type of unit you are actually going to stay in. Our son had a great time at the pool. We did not utilize any of the other ammenities at the resort so I cannot comment on them. We would be willing to return for another stay.

Reviews.Title: “outdated”
Reviews.Author: whoshome
Reviews.Content: Let me start with what we enjoyed. Indian Point had wonderful boats for rent at better rates than others we looked into. The boats are in good shape as well as the dock. The only thing that was a bit iffy was they want you to sign an open credit card incase you damage the boat in anyway. There is no insurance available and no one under 21 can drive the boats or jet skis. There are alot of deer around the park-that was nice. But.... The RV park was awful. The water is not close.The sites are small and trees are overgrown. We had a thorn tree over our picnic table. We cut it back so we could sit at the table. They have rvs for rent but some were not inhabitable. The people who rented one were moved. The said the telephone did not work or the shower and it was infested with ants. The window was broken and duct taped and you had to squeeze past the airconditioner to get in the door. Another rental rv user we spoke to said everything in his unit worked but it was not very clean. We spoke to several (7 families) rvers in the park all were first timers and we did not find anyone who was happy. All said they would not be back. There are 3 mobile homes that appear to be occupied by staff and the police were there for several hours the first night. We truly felt like trailer trash. I felt bad for my family since I had picked the park. When we first drove in I was disapointed on arrival. I told them it would be a nice spot once it was dark and we couldn't see. Then the cops showed up. One rv site is on the side of the road on a hill. It was not level. The guy had the front of his camper on the ground and his only area was a very small deck and then a ravine. I was afraid someone would drive by and hit his camper it sticks out in the road. . The rv park seems like it was built in the 50's and appears to have had very little attention since. Our sewer hookup had no lid was only covered by a rock. The trash dumpster is not within walking distance if you are carrying much trash. There is a shower house available. I was thankful we did not need it. The toilet had no lid on the tank. There was no trash however. There is very little room for kids to play and it would not be safe due to they layout. All the sites we looked at had a small patio or deck and then dropped of the slope. We felt they should level the place and start over. When you look at their website you will not find any pictures of the park or spaces. We now know why. There is a really nice rv park across the street that is a state park and they had beautiful sites. No pool but the lake is closer. We tried to eat at a restaurant on the point one evening at 7 and the they were all closed.

Reviews.Title: “Probably Not What You Hoped For”
Reviews.Author: gocats4693
Reviews.Content: We have 3 boys and wanted a basic spot close to the lake. The unit we stayed in did accomplish this goal, but was very dated. I was surprised for the price that our "unit" didn't have central air and had holes in the shower. It was very close to the pool, which is heated and very nice. There is no daily maid service and you have to haul your own trash. I was also very surprised that although the unit had a coffee maker, they don't supply even a coffee filter. The air conditioner was loud and the sink was the smallest I have ever seen in any hotel or motel room ever. This resort has seen better days and we won't be returning. I was also almost sold this accommodation by a website called Branson Tourism Center that was going to charge us another $200 over the rate directly from the hotel. I don't mind someone making a living, but this is ridiculous markup for the service provided.

Reviews.Title: “Rustic, no frills, but a great stay with kiddo!”
Reviews.Author: FunMom2005
Reviews.Content: This was our first family vacation with our 35 month old son. Originally, we booked a "lakefront resort unit" as part of a package through another website. When we got there, the picture we saw on the website was NOT the accomodations we were actually booked in. The staff was wonderfully understanding, and upgraded us to one of their log cabins. If you do stay at Trail's End, spend the extra money for the cabin. It is so worth it! The resort units are pretty outdated, and the one we almost stayed in had a mildewy, musty smell that I couldn't get past. Clean, but not for us. The location is great. Right up the road from Silver Dollar City, and right on the lake. They have a dock, and very reasonable boat rentals. We rented a bass boat for half the day, and it was a great addition to our weekend. The cabin was clean and well stocked with essentials, and even had a fireplace. It was extremely quiet, which was so nice! Plenty of room for our son to play and for us to relax. My husband did some fishing off the dock, but unfortunately didn't catch anything. It is definitely no frills, so don't expect room service or turn down service, but with a kitchen, it's great if you want to save a few bucks on food. The only negative things I can say are that the beds are old and kind of uncomfortable (bring an extra pillow or two from home, too), and the hot water could have lasted longer. Also, if you are thinking you're going to eat out, be ready to drive a considerable distance into town. It wasn't an issue for us, but you should definitely know you're not on the strip. Overall, we had a great time, and will definitely go back. Do not stay here if you are wanting to be pampered, but do stay if you want to relax away from the hustle and bustle of Branson.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the stay at Trails End Cabin”
Reviews.Author: skeeterConway_AR
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights here during the Christmas holiday. The cabin was very cozy and quaint and we enjoyed our stay. It is not luxurious by any means but clean and quiet. We have stayed in motels for this price that did not have a fireplace or a kitchen as this cabin did. The only suggestion that I would have for the owners is that they need to include some type of cabinet or rack for people to hang their clothes.

Reviews.Title: “Backdrop for Branson's 50/60's show”
Reviews.Author: TBill13
Reviews.Content: Located on the lake. Park like setting with swings and waterfront. Paddleboats available. Rooms very clean but antiquated - '50/'60 era decorating - vinyl chairs showed much use. Noisy refrigerator and window AC unit. Limited TV channels. Similar unit along America's byways could only command half the rate charged in Branson. Great spot for families wanting to minimize food expenses - has small kitchen with utensils and an outdoor grill. Down the road from Silver Dollar City - congestion at peak times. Does not have much romantic appeal. Staff is very friendly

HotelInfo.Name: Trail's End Resort and RV Park at Indian Point
HotelInfo.Address: 71 Dogwood Park Trail, Indian Point, Branson, MO 65616
